required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reliability and Reproducibility of the Eye Check Tonometer
clinical_study.official_title: Reliability and Reproducibility of the Eye Check Tonometer Pressure Measurements as Measured by Patients Reliability and Reproducibility of the Eye Check Tonometer Pressure Measurements as Measured by Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate whether the new applanation tonometer (EyeCheck monitor) can provide intraocular pressure (IOP) measurements comparable to those of traditional tonometers such as the Goldmann applanation tonometer and the Tonopen.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All subjects will first take their pressure using the EyeCheck with contact lens in and then remove their lens have pressures taken with Goldmann and Tonopen (two standard of care techniques of taking pressures of the eyes).

primary_outcome.description: Compare EyeCheck intraocular pressure (IOP) measurements comparable to those of traditional tonometers (Goldmann and tonopen)

arm_group.description: EyeCheck pressures will be measured with contact lens in place
Pressures will be measured with both Goldmann and Tonopen (both traditional tonometers to take the intraocular pressure (IOP) measurements of the eye).

intervention.description: EyeCheck is a newly developed device to provide intraocular pressure (IOP) measurements of the eyes.
Standard of care intraocular pressures will be taken using the Goldmann and Tonopen to compare to the EyeCheck.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age of 18 years or older,
- Any glaucoma patient or glaucoma suspect patient
- Presents for an appointment wearing their own soft contact lens.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Arthritis affecting the upper extremity in the patient or caregiver
- Patient unwilling or assessed to be unable to comply with the study protocol
- Any corneal abnormalities such as opacities, scars, Fuchs dystrophy, map dot fingerprint dystrophy, history of recurrent corneal abrasion, corneal surgery such as Lasik, PRK, DSAEK, transplant or implant
- History of any ongoing ocular symptoms such as eye pain or redness or discharge
- History of recent ocular surgery (done in the past 3 months)
- History of a any filtering or tube surgery for glaucoma (to reduce risk of infection associated complications)
- Recent eye infection (within the past 3 months)
- History of diabetes for > 5 years duration
- Monocular patient
- Best corrected visual acuity< 20/70
- Head or hand tremors

patient_data.ipd_description: Currently, there is no plan to share data with other researchers.
